text: I think that more or less tonight we'll
have a final decision on going on with
the minor details for the next day or
two having a sense of leading obviously
to an agreement on both sides which will
settle things down but your sense is
that the creditors eurozone governments
the IMF are pleased with the new
submission that you put forward yes they
have accepted the new proposals of the
Greek government is a proper framework
on which to work on and with some
adjustments that will be the issue of
discussion for the next day or so we'll
end up with proper technical solution as
well so your hope would be a communique
from government heads tonight broadly
welcoming the outline and then some
negotiations on the detail exactly the
our expectation is that it will be a
very positive communicate tonight
underlying also the areas where the
technical details have to be fixed in
the next day or so the basic idea was
very simple
there will be new taxation on business
and the wealthier part of the society
and we will save pensions and wages this
is the very basic idea so we try to
remove the tax burden from pensions and
wages the world's business and wealth so
broadly new taxes on the wealthy an
additional tax on business but you won't
have to cut pensions which was obviously
something that creditors were asking for
but you felt crossed a line exactly we I
think it was because obviously
pensioners
and wage earners have suffered roughly a
40% decline during the previous five
years this constitutes a ton of the red
lines of our government but you have to
find the solution but the red line is no
further cuts in pensions and wages we
stick to stick to this idea and I think
we came up with alternative propositions
which they are accepted say you must be
a very relieved Tassel I am in a way
because otherwise things could turn into
an area and options that would be very
disastrous both for the Greek economy
also I think for the European partners
